timeline.bodyText: A question at line 20: "${branch}" does not work well for manual invocation if grpc-java is a custom branch or commit hash and grpc is master. Why not just use 'master'?
timeline.author: dapengzhang0

replies.bodyText:
Just always using master would mean that changes to the test framework at head on grpc/grpc could break tests running on the release branches, e.g. v1.28.x. This is undesirable. There was some discussion around obtaining the corresponding branch at grpc/grpc-go#3456 (and referenced from #6828).
Since this is in the kokoro directory I didn't put much effort into making this robust to manual runs.
replies.author: ericgribkoff
